protocol_name: SNPs calling of Apostichopus japonicus color-variants genome
protocol_name_html: SNPs calling of Apostichopus japonicus color-variants genome
description:
SNPs calling protocol for analysis the genetic polymorphism among natural color variants. This protocol accompanies the following GigaScience publication:

 

Jihoon Jo, et al.  (2016): Draft genome of the sea cucumber Apostichopus japonicus and genetic polymorphism among color variants. GigaScience...
protocol_affiliation: School of Biological Sciences and Technology, Chonnam National University
manuscript_citation: Jihoon Jo, Jooseong Oh, Hyun-Gwan Lee, Hyun-Hee Hong, Sung-Gwon Lee, Seongmin Cheon, Elizabeth M. A. Kern, Soyeong Jin, Sung-Jin Cho, Joong-Ki Park, Chungoo Park; Draft genome of the sea cucumber Apostichopus japonicus and genetic polymorphism among color variants. Gigascience 2017; 6 (1): 1-6. doi: 10.1093/gigascience/giw006

components.data: Realign the reads from assembled genome using BWA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Realign the reads from assembled genome using BWA.

components.data: Group the aligned reads, mark and remove duplicate reads using Picard.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Group the aligned reads, mark and remove duplicate reads using Picard.

components.data:
Realign the reads with indels using GATK

 

RealignerTargetCreator and IndelRealigner.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Realign the reads with indels using GATK

 

RealignerTargetCreator and IndelRealigner.

components.data: Call SNPs and indels from the resulting sequence in step 1-3 using GATK Haplotypecaller.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Call SNPs and indels from the resulting sequence in step 1-3 using GATK Haplotypecaller.

components.data: Measure nucleotide diversity in your genome using VCFtools with sliding window analysis (bin 10kb, step 1kb).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Measure nucleotide diversity in your genome using VCFtools with sliding window analysis (bin 10kb, step 1kb).
